verses.verse: Then Job<WH347> answered<WH6030> and said,<WH559>
I have heard<WH8085> many<WH7227> such<WH428> things: miserable<WH5999> comforters<WH5162> are you all.<WH3605>
Shall vain<WH7307> words<WH1697> have an end?<WH7093> or<WH176> what<WH4100> emboldens<WH4834> you that you answer?<WH6030>

I also<WH1571> could speak<WH1696> as you do: if<WH3863> your soul<WH5315> were in my soul's<WH5315> stead,<WH8478> I could heap<WH2266> up words<WH4405> against<WH5921> you, and shake<WH5128> my head<WH7218> at you.
But I would strengthen<WH553> you with my mouth,<WH6310> and the moving<WH5205> of my lips<WH8193> should assuage<WH2820> your grief.
Though<WH518> I speak,<WH1696> my grief<WH3511> is not assuaged:<WH2820> and though I forbear,<WH2308> what<WH4100> am I eased?<WH1980>
But now<WH6258> he has made me weary:<WH3811> you have made desolate<WH8074> all<WH3605> my company.<WH5712>
And you have filled<WH7059> me with wrinkles,<WH7059> which is a witness<WH5707> against me: and my leanness<WH3585> rising<WH6965> up in me bears<WH6030> witness<WH6030> to my face.<WH6440>
He tears<WH2963> me in his wrath,<WH639> who hates<WH7852> me: he gnashes<WH2786> on me with his teeth;<WH8127> my enemy<WH6862> sharpens<WH3913> his eyes<WH5869> on me.

They have gaped<WH6473> on me with their mouth;<WH6310> they have smitten<WH5221> me on the cheek<WH3895> reproachfully;<WH2781> they have gathered<WH4390> themselves together<WH3162> against<WH5921> me.
God<WH410> has delivered<WH5462> me to the ungodly,<WH5760> and turned<WH3399> me over<WH5921> into<WH413> the hands<WH3027> of the wicked.<WH7563>
I was at ease,<WH7961> but he has broken<WH6565> me asunder: he has also taken<WH247> me by my neck,<WH6203> and shaken<WH6327> me to pieces, and set<WH6965> me up for his mark.<WH4307>
His archers<WH7228> compass<WH5437> me round<WH5437> about, he splits<WH6398> my reins<WH3629> asunder, and does not spare;<WH2550> he pours<WH8210> out my gall<WH4845> on the ground.<WH776>
He breaks<WH6555> me with breach<WH6556> on breach,<WH6556> he runs<WH7323> on me like a giant.<WH1368>
I have sewed<WH8609> sackcloth<WH8242> on my skin,<WH1539> and defiled<WH5953> my horn<WH7161> in the dust.<WH6083>
My face<WH6440> is foul<WH2560> with weeping,<WH1065> and on<WH5921> my eyelids<WH6079> is the shadow<WH6757> of death;<WH6757>
Not for any injustice<WH2555> in my hands:<WH3709> also my prayer<WH8605> is pure.<WH2134>
O earth,<WH776> cover<WH3680> not you my blood,<WH1818> and let my cry<WH2201> have<WH1961> no<WH408> place.<WH4725>
Also<WH1571> now,<WH6258> behold,<WH2009> my witness<WH5707> is in heaven,<WH8064> and my record<WH7717> is on high.<WH4791>
My friends<WH7453> scorn<WH3887> me: but my eye<WH5869> pours<WH1811> out tears to God.<WH433>
O that one might plead<WH3198> for a man<WH1397> with God,<WH433> as a man<WH120> pleads for his neighbor!<WH7453>
When<WH3588> a few<WH4557> years<WH8141> are come,<WH857> then I shall go<WH1980> the way<WH734> from where I shall not return.<WH7725>
